definition: lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard

sentences.english: But their quality call mainly fell on deaf ears in the U.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们在质量方面的呼吁在美国却被当作耳旁风。
汤姆没把法官的警告当耳旁风。
汤姆没把法官的警告当耳旁风。

sentences.english: You regard the beneficial words as a puff of wind, and will regret it sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 你把金玉良言当作耳旁风，总有一天会后悔的。

sentences.english: What I say goes in one ear and out the other.
sentences.chinese: 我所说的全被当做耳旁风了。

sentences.english: She would feel heartbroken if she knew that her advice to you had fallen on deaf ears.
sentences.chinese: 如果她知道你把她的忠告当成耳旁风，她会很伤心的。

definition: lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard
lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard
to take seriously (often with negative expression: "don't take it too seriously")/to treat conscientiously
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to continue in one's own way (idiom)
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
crazy talk/ravings/nonsense
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to play deaf-mute
to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
pillow talk
to scold
sarcastic comments (idiom)/to make sarcastic comments
to order sb about/to use sb
